intro: Minuartia sibirica, commonly known as the Siberian rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the cold regions of Asia and Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has a mat-forming growth habit, with small, fleshy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Minuartia sibirica is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
